title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 8.4
body:
https://i.imgur.com/F81h0d2.jpg

Hey everyone and welcome to Patch 8.4, the "It's Definitely Not Mid-Season but WOAH, lots of changes" Patch.

I’m Riot Novalas & I’m a QA Analyst on Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who work on Core Gameplay playing new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they’re released. It’s our job to test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we’re introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun.

Patch Chat serves as an opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks.
You can find information on the most recent patch by following this link:
https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-84-notes

Rolling into this patch, we've got a minor AP itemization overhaul with some new & old faces! Say hello to Spellbinder ... and our dear old friend, Twin Shadows. Lots of the items have been tweaked as well.  If you're a mage, your itemization may have changed up. We'll be more than happy to push you onto the right path!  On the other side, Rengar Q has been reverted. Squishy champions beware because The Hunt Is On. Volibear has also received some changes that add on another method of skill expression to his kit. 

There are buffs and nerfs aplenty this patch.  We've got buffs to Darius, Evelynn, Fiddlesticks, Renekton, and more. Tristana, Zoe, and a few others took some hits as well. Tracker's Knife is now dead and there's a new rune in Resolve (Bone Plating!). Baron & Elder Dragon have received some major buffs as well. 

Ask us ANYTHING about 8.4. We're here to answer questions about your favorite champions, inquiries about runes, or maybe how often we execute to jungle camps! Let's talk mage items or maybe discuss shifts in the jungle! We're also down to just chat, though.

Disclaimer: We have no insight on upcoming/future skins.

Chris “Auberaun” Roberts
Christy “Riot Ender L” Frierson
Nick “Riot Endstep” Frijia
Sigmundur “GangIeri” Helgason
Arnor “Riot Hjarta” Halldorsson
Rob “Riot King Cobra” Rosa
Miktat “Riot Koyuncu” Koyuncu
Brian “Riot Madness Heroo” Pressoir
Nabi “Riot Novalas” Barak
Dan “Riot penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee

replies.body: Removing tracker's knife has left lee sin with a nerf while he is already weak imo, especialy when sightstone is also no longer in the game. Seems weird that you wouldn't at least buff him a bit this patch to make up for the nerf.  Are you considering any changes to his kit to make up for tracker's knife?

I think this one is actually pretty interesting - Lee Sin can no longer go trackers, but now has to take Stalker's or Skirmishers, both of which give actual combat power. Obviously the ability to ward hop is super valuable for Lee and definitely has a meaningful impact on fights, but I imagine that Lee Sin players are just going to keep their yellow trinket to be able to ward hop. Having to think more meaningfully about when it's worth it to ward hop because you have less wards overall on is certainly a feelsbad, but I'm unsure what the impact on his power level will be.

Hi!
Do you feel some non keystone in resolve underwhelming?

I personally find Iron Skin & Mirror Shell underwhelming. I feel like their early game defensive niche currently does not outweigh the benefit of waiting ten minutes for a substantially better effect.

(Keep in mind that this is from the perspective of a support main who typically goes against a combination of physical and magic damage in the bottom lane).

Making Resolve's minor runes more satisfying is something we've explored a bit but didn't find a great way to do it - as far as I know that work is on hold but we are aware that some of the runes in Resolve (Iron Skin and Mirror Shell are big standouts) are difficult to appreciate.

So i see there are some gnar changes in the patch what I want to inquire about is when it comes to champions similar to gnar with access to both ranged and Melee forms, what changes are you looking to make so they aren't oppressive to deal with but also fill their role nicely?

In layman's terms: How do you balance champions who can be both Melee and Ranged so that us players don't smash our keyboards in frustration at what we consider "Bullshit" Design.

Realistically, having ranged/melee split champions in lane is inevitably going to come with some frustration - really, every type of champion in the game can cause some frustration, it's just a matter of degree. Personally I'd say Gnar and Jayce often violate the limits of how frustrating a champion should be to lane against, but at other times they're fine, so it's mostly down to their level of power and sharpness of matchups - meaning the frustration comes when they are tuned to be strong moreso than other champions (and/or in counter matchups), primarily because when they are strong they feel like they invalidate the cast of melee laners in lane. If it feels like picking a melee is asking to experience 10-15 minutes of misery with little opportunity to play the game, that's obviously not good - even if that feeling isn't true.

My hope is that at some point we can get Gnar and Jayce into a state where they can exist as strong laners that work well into melees but don't invalidate them, but that's a difficult state to keep them in given how sensitive they can be to small/indirect balance shifts. 

We have some really promising exploration for Gnar potentially coming in a future patch that we wanted to put in 8.4 but didn't have time to properly validate. It's intended to be a set of win-win changes to make Gnar's gameplay feel more fluid and rewarding but also give him more windows of opportunity to use against him and in general make playing against him a more interesting/fun experience - can't say more than that but personally I really like the direction. It's currently looking unlikely we'll get to it soon but I'm hoping we'll manage to get it in a future patch at some point.

Thanks for the insight, I would also like to inquire this: If needed would you guys ever decrease Gnar/Jayce's aa range when they are in Ranged Mode so that there is room for champion with short ranged poke abilities to actually trade with them? Basically the idea would be that if they want to do small skrimishes they should also be at risk of taking damage back from the enemy laner without overwhelming as they currently can do.

Edit: An example is {{champion:82}} vs {{champion:150}} , one of the more notorious match-ups for Morde since Gnar mini-form outranges his E poke and endlessly harasses him away from the minion wave even if he's under his tower.

It's something we've considered before, but not something we've found a good list for. Specifically, we've tried reducing Gnar's early AA range internally (he gains range per level due to his passive which we left untouched) and found that it left him with such a weak earlygame it was hard to justify picking him over other options. Personally I think there is some merit to the idea, but it would have to come with other changes to the kit, likely something to reward Gnar for playing aggressively, and we haven't found something that fits well there.

Just wondering, but is there really a need for him to gain attack range with each level in his mini-form? I always thought of gnar to be that short-ranged top lane tank who, once he filled his rage bar, could engage fights and come out still hanging by a rope if he played it right. His current iteration feels more along the lines of: Once i hit level 3 you're never touching me or any of the minions I'm pushing into your tower.

Then again I play mostly {{champion:82}} and {{champion:266}} in the top lane, so I'm not sure how much most of my input here means against the piles of data you guys have backlogged.

In an ideal world, the attack range per level is there to offset the increased danger of being close to enemies as the game goes on. Realistically, it's a lot of what makes Gnar frustrating since the more powerful you get (as you go up in levels), Gnar gets more and more difficult to touch as he's longer ranged and faster, though it's by so little per level that it's difficult to tell ingame that the range/speed is why he's increasingly difficult to all-in. The issue with removing his incremental range is that he's then put into a spot where he either needs the stats to scrap it out with other fighters to some degree (if he were very short range at all times, like Urgot) or just start at a high enough range that it's effectively the same or higher for most of the laning phase, which is obviously not an improvement from the side of the enemy melee. Alternatively, there's some thought that maybe he could have low range and be rewarded more for aggressive plays, but as I mentioned earlier we haven't found a good way to implement that. 

Player input definitely means a lot - even if we have tons of data saying that Gnar isn't even particularly good in soloqueue, feelings of frustration are definitely valid and understandable.

Hey guys, can someone on your team take the time to nerf Support Items on Twisted Treeline please? Like by Patch 8.6 by the latest? Player behavior there has gotten to the point where your teammates will threaten to intentionally feed or grief and verbally abuse anyone who does not even _suggest_ playing a hyper-carry comp. Happens like 40% of the time. The solution is very simple and wouldn't take up a lot of that person's time, while it would improve the League experience of anyone who plays TT. Just remove Bandit at the very least from the Timeworn items. If you feel like it, you can also remove their GP10.

Thank you.
Removing bandit from support items is something we're exploring. Unsure if that'll apply to TT but I'll fwd your concerns.
What's your thoughts on the state of Skarner after 8.1 and him seeing play in the LCS?

After the Skarner buffs, the playtest team generally thought he was quite strong both in soloqueue and potentially for competitive. I'm of the opinion that Skarner is pretty fair and don't mind seeing him as a strong jungler, but I'm less enthused by the way his spires often encourage non-interaction (if Skarner has a spire he can't really be contested, if Skarner doesn't have a spire he'll often just refuse to commit to jungle fights). Overall I think he's relatively reasonable as a tank jungler, but wish that there was a bit more gameplay around his spires and would prefer his clear wasn't so fast/healthy so he'd have a bit more downtime on the map.
Might be a sensitive subject, but would you rather see him remove the spires and get a new passive or would you rather want to tweak and improve upon the spires?

It's not really up to us since we're not designers, but I'm of the opinion that spires could be cool if they were tweaked some - it's a unique and interesting mechanic, I just don't think the current version is done in a way that feels good for the Skarner player and the players interacting with Skarner (both allies and enemies).

Master Yi's Q cooldown is reduced by 1 second every time he attacks something. What do you think of this mechanic? Does it add depth to his gameplay, or does it just punish him for playing fights strategically and using Meditate, and waiting for good opportunities to attack? Do you think it makes Master Yi players act too aggressive in combat? Do you think it's one of the major reasons he's less effective in high elo, where melees naturally can't attack enemies as much? Would he be more balanced and healthier if the mechanic was removed and the base cooldown was lowered?

Personally I really like this mechanic and think of it as a more elegant version of Yasuo's Q cooldown (which scales directly with attack speed, as opposed to indirectly in this case). I'm of the opinion that it adds a lot of depth to Yi's gameplay, especially given that Yi has an AS steroid and an AA reset in his kit (which can both be used to accelerate/"cheat" the Q cooldown refund). 

I'd say an important part of the Q cooldown refund is it also rewards Master Yi for building AS in a way other than straight damage - giving him more mobility/target access/untargetability the more AS he has, which is one of the things that allows Yi to function as a melee carry in a game that's very hostile to melee carries. 

As far as Yi's discrepancy between low and high elo, I don't feel that the Q refund mechanic is the cause. While Yi will average getting off more attacks in lower elo, that refund is also going to be better utilized/optimized in high elo where each Alpha Strike has much higher value. For comparison, look at Tryndamere, who has a similar refund mechanic (on crit) on his E, who has very little difference between his high and low elo winrates - though obviously the comparison isn't perfect, it's a good demonstration that the mechanic is unlikely to be the sole (or primary) cause of the discrepancy. 

Without the refund mechanic on Q I don't believe Yi would be any healthier, especially not if the base cooldown was lowered to compensate. To me that just encourages AD/CDR builds with little to no attackspeed where the focus of the champion is on repeated Q casts rather than actually autoattacking, which would be a fairly degenerate pattern since the main counterplay to Yi is preventing him from autoattacking via hard cc/spacing/etc., which is no longer real counterplay if all Yi needs to do is just cast spells rather than autoattack. That would be pretty similar to the old AP Yi play pattern, although likely not quite as offensive.

Gotta say i have major concerns about how tanky singed can build + how much damage he can deal just by having{{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} with the rest of his items being defensive health items, given i have only played one game vs that so far but it was not very much fun to play against so would you consider changing the increased impairment damage to only be based off of champion abilities and not items?

That's not a very likely approach to take on Liandry's given that the synergy with Rylai's is one of the compelling parts of the item for some champions and that the movement impairing synergy is already limited to a small cast of champions - making that group smaller would make Liandry's a very niche item which have been difficult to balance/support in the past. 

If it makes you feel any better, mathematically the 8.4 changes don't make much difference for Singed's damage with Rylai's+Liandry's in most cases (except against high MR and/or low HP targets, where is damage is up) - he could do a very similar amount of damage before.

Will there be any other changes to nocturne, that will actually make him better at dealing damage to champions? The PBE buff only gives him better jungle clear and longer ultimate vision denial, but the actual attack speed buff duration from W got nerfed, so overall Noc will be weaker in 1v1s which isn't a good thing to see...
Think having that better jungle clear alone is potent enough for Nocturne but we'll potentially be exploring more changes if necessary for the 8.5 cycle.

Rageblade has been a topic of discussion (whether it should be nerfed for ranged/buffed for melee/generally readjusted) some here recently, no plans for anything as of right now though.
More range-melee splits please. Besides making melee/range only items, I’ve liked this direction on items.
Agreed, it's something I've been arguing more for recently after having seen its success with things like Sterak's and Wit's End.
Speaking of Sterak's, do you think we still need the Steraks/Maw interaction? That mostly seemed to be aimed at ranged champs with Graves who abused the two items and seems outdated now.
was wits end changed because of kai'sa? I feel its previous iteration would have broken her if paired with rageblade and nashors

No, the motivation for changing Wit's End was one developer going through and doing a pass on items that don't fulfill their intended purpose. Wit's End is (ideally) meant to be a strategic option for fighters against comps with high amounts of magic damage, and it wasn't doing that so he readjusted the item to hopefully put it in a spot where fighters might be interested in it again. 

We did try Wit's End Kai'Sa quite a bit but didn't think it was overbearing before or after the Wit's End changes. In general we weren't looking to nerf it for ranged champions much, rather just readjust it for melees.

hmmm, I think the problem stems from the fact that very few melee champions that deal magic damage want attack speed... I think in general very few melee champions would want any sort of attack speed outside of Trinity, bork and/or PD.

For example a core user of wits end would be WW, but I am fairly certain against heavy AP comps he would be better off just buying merc treads and spirit visage.

Maaaaybe it could be viable combined with rageblade for xin zao and shyvanna, but I still feel they both have better builds in both cases

Just from first impressions, the new keystone seems really strong on a lot of fighters that were previously buffed (Aatrox, Tryndamere come to mind, I'm sure there are others)

Do you think that the keystone will either need to be toned down, or some of these buffs may need to be reverted?

It's a possibility in some cases, but we're still trying to figure out exactly how the new keystone will work and how it will be balanced, so that's something we'll look more into as we're closer to shipping the rune (it's not going in the next patch, 8.5, it's just been put on the PBE early). 

I'm currently of the opinion that some champions are inevitably going to be outliers with this keystone and will need some balance adjustments to account for the power of Conquerer, but I'm not totally sure. While in an ideal world we wouldn't nerf champions due to keystone usage/synergy, realistically it will happen sometimes and will likely happen in this case.
